page.title: 07CUSTOMS
page.content: Yateley is fortunate to have a large village green surviving from the Middle Ages which is used extensively for sports and the annual village May Fayre. At this Fayre Maypole dancing takes place. May Day garlands of crossed flowerbedecked hoops hung with a doll representing the Virgin Mary have been carried in procession, a tradition dating back to the Middle Ages and unique to Yateley. Other customs include Beating the Bounds by the Parish Clerk and there is a 'Tithing stone're-set in the Choir Vestry of St. Peters Church. Yateley has its own Mummers play mentioned in the Hampshire Federation of Womens Insitutes' book. Yateley has its own Morris dancers.
